body_html:
I see, this one is much simpler:

import tensorflow as tf
tf.enable_eager_execution()

layer = tf.keras.layers.Dense(5)
inputs = tf.zeros([32, 100], tf.float32)
labels = tf.zeros([32], tf.int64)

for i in range(100000):
  tf.losses.sparse_softmax_cross_entropy(labels, inputs)
  print(len(tf.get_default_graph().get_collection(tf.GraphKeys.LOSSES)))

You can tf.reset_default_graph() to work around the issue. The fix will probably be to not add to a global collection. Thank you for the report!

body:
I see, this one is much simpler:

```
import tensorflow as tf
tf.enable_eager_execution()

layer = tf.keras.layers.Dense(5)
inputs = tf.zeros([32, 100], tf.float32)
labels = tf.zeros([32], tf.int64)

for i in range(100000):
  tf.losses.sparse_softmax_cross_entropy(labels, inputs)
  print(len(tf.get_default_graph().get_collection(tf.GraphKeys.LOSSES)))
```

You can `tf.reset_default_graph()` to work around the issue. The fix will probably be to not add to a global collection. Thank you for the report!
